title: Is this how Remake is supposed to work?
body: All 5 players in game, I kill Illaoi for first blood solo, and they get remake - feels like maybe yasuo was in fountain until 1:30 given his level, but why on earth are you allowed to remake if people are no longer afk? It was 4 to 1 remake vote as well...

replies.body: To trigger a /remake vote, a player must be disconnected for at least 90 seconds of the first 3 minutes. It becomes invalid if a player on his team dies *before* he is registered as disconnected, so if his team dies after that then it will work. You can read more about /remake here; https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208754686--Remake-FAQ

Gotcha, but my point is in practice, it looks like Yasuo was afk for a bit, but came to lane (you see all have items), Moment I got first blood top, the enemy team chose to remake, vote was 4-1. Maybe they wanted to dodge the troll yasuo support, but my point is I don't think it's fair to have a remake so early - that means all you have to do is wait in the fountain until 1:31 to have the open option of remaking in the first 3 minutes.
I guess the real question would be if the Yasuo was truly disconnected for the first 1:30 or if he just stayed in base "afk"

A remake won't trigger if someone decides to leave after First Blood.  A player needs have already been afk for the required duration in order to activate the feature.  DTN provided some great information here, and a link to our [Remake Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208754686--Remake-FAQ) which should provide some more information.
